website_summaries.verdict: A quality choice for someone looking for jewelry store-style cleaning from the comfort of home.
pros: We loved the design of the Magnasonic
Unit is big enough to fit a pair of glasses
Works effectively to remove sweat and grime buildup from the nose piece of glasses
Varying sizes of holes in the plastic bin to be an excellent design for any size of jewelry
cons: Runs slightly louder than its competitors, but not too loud

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on the reviews, and I'm so happy with it. I have free cleaning at my jewelers, but it's so rare that I'm able to make it there. I realized that my ring needed a better cleaning than I could do with my solution at home when people stopped commenting on how pretty it was. I've added a before and after. I ran it twice on the 480 seconds setting and it looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Silent E

customer_reviews.title: It’s great when it worked properly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in August 2017. It was great for awhile. There is a button you press to increase the length of time the machine will run. That button no longer works. The default setting is 180 seconds. I like the run time to be longer than that. Now I have to plug it in, it runs for 180 seconds, I unplug it and plug it in again, it runs for 180 seconds and so on and so forth. I figure it won’t be long until it stops working altogether. I will purchase my next one from Hammacher Schlemmer. I’m sure it will cost more, but it comes with a lifetime guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: lorna

customer_reviews.title: 3 minutes to sparkle
customer_reviews.text: I just used this and I am IN LOVE!! I paired it with the Blitz jewelry cleaner. My rings were gross from lotion, sunscreen, hand soap, sweat etc. I don't have time to run to my jeweler to get them professionally cleaned. This does the trick, and same exact results! In 3 minutes 💕
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Morea

customer_reviews.title: Handy sonic jewelry cleaner cleans effectively
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect, but this value priced device is a little workhorse! I was careful to read instructions, making sure to avoid cleaning certain jewelry that could be damaged by the process. I cleaned my wedding rings, gold and silver chains, silverware, and even some coins just to see how well it worked. While most pieces required some amount of cloth polishing after the sonic cleaning, the results were excellent with the jewelry, pretty good with silverware, and just so-so with the coins. But since it's intended for jewelry, that's what counts.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Ch.

customer_reviews.title: Great little cleaner not super powerful
customer_reviews.text: Actually really like this thing. You can clean sunglasses, rings and a bunch of other things with this cleaner. I use it mostly for my engagement ring. I wish it were a little more powerful, I feel like I have to run it on the longest cycle a few times to get it really clean. Also the sound that it emits sometimes makes my ears ring...
customer_reviews.author: Dr.CorryTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT AFTER DEGAS
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on numerous pieces of jewelry. One thing that the directions that come with the unit is the need to degas the water prior to starting a cleaning cycle. This means that after you put hot tap water into the unit and any cleaner sach as a little dish soap, you should run the unit for enough time that some air bubbles exit the water and then a slight turbulence begins. This removes any air that is in the water which hampers the cleaning action.
customer_reviews.author: Garyheim

customer_reviews.title: Questionable durability
customer_reviews.text: This machine worked well during the 1st year of normal use but starts to falter just few months after the one yr. warranty expires. I usually use it for my dentures and jewelry at least 3 times a week and followed maintenance instructions to the book. The timer buttons are stuck to one time cycle (180 seconds) and won't respond to any other set cycle. Sometimes it won't turn on at all. It clearly shows that this product is not robust and reliable and should have been cycled test in the factory. It failed at only 450 cycles ( 13 month of normal daily use).
customer_reviews.author: Totustuus

customer_reviews.title: This is a good thing, as I didn't want it to be ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit is tiny. I was expecting something bulky and clunky, bigger than a toaster, but this is about half the size of a football. This is a good thing, as I didn't want it to be large. The plastic basket insert is very useful. Operation is simple and straightforward. It makes a small amount of noise when operating, but not much. my electric shaver is much louder. I use it to clean encrusted ink out of fountain pens and it works marvelously for that task.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan WoodTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Does nothing
customer_reviews.text: I've tried this thing on dirty coins and jewelry and, even at the maximum duration and with a bit of Dawn added to the mix it has no effect on the dirty items.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality -- broke down after several months
customer_reviews.text: It worked great. For a while. After several months, one of the buttons (the one that sets the cycle) stopped working. A few weeks later, the display stopped working. Shortly after that, the power button stopped working too. Now it's completely dead. Like other reviewers have posted, it's not worth packaging up and paying the postage and waiting indefinitely for a "possible repair".
customer_reviews.author: Mort

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this almost a year, have experimented with it about ten times now, and have yet to find anything it does well, or does at all. I'm So disappointed. Perhaps I received a defective unit, but it appears to be working perfectly. My analysis suggests that the vibrating parts are inadequate for the required fluid volume, or the design. It looks the part. It has nice bells and whistles, design, even a nice fit and finish. It just lacks substance. Your mileage may vary, but I recommend looking for another solution.
customer_reviews.author: ebreeze1

customer_reviews.title: It will clean the crap out of anything you put in it
customer_reviews.text: It will clean the crap out of anything you put in it!! great product for rings and all. I also put sunglasses in it (put anything like that in the little basket that comes w/ it). It will etch the surface of glasses if they are face-down on in the system. It etched the crap out of my sunglasses one day. 4 stars because it did not do a good enough job to inform me it will etch soft surfaces of things if it is put in without the trey. It ruined my sunglasses. It's super powerful and a great product, I just wish it did a better job with the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work, avoid!!!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived DOA. Motor does not work. Did nothing when I hit start. Sent them a message about a week ago but failed to get a response. Avoid this machine and company!
customer_reviews.author: BBQ_POPE

customer_reviews.title: This machine is Great!
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research this was my top pick and the top rated online. Boy does it clean good! It says everything that it is supposed to do and is one powerful machine. Only downside is the instructions do not tell you what setting to clean what jewelry and it is not as quiet as the description says. All and all it is amazing and I get great joy at seeing all the nastiness it takes off of my jewelry after cleaning. Came on time and I am one happy customer. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C

customer_reviews.title: Ring still has crud it it.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to clean my ring four times so far. The first 2 times, I followed the manufacturer's directions to just use water and ran it on the longest cycle. It did not come out looking clean at all. Next, I tried the suggestion of microwaving the water first to make it hot and adding a drop of dawn dishwashing detergent. Still dirty. Last time I was a little more generous with the dawn, but it is still dirty. It really needs a brush. I think I will go try a jewelry cleaner and brush which has always worked before.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2

customer_reviews.title: Really like this cleaner
customer_reviews.text: For a sonic cleaner that doesn't require chemicals this works wonderfully. I use this primarily to clean my handmade vape coils which are made from some fairly dirty wire. You can see the difference after a cycle or 2 and cleans them well enough to remove all dirt and dust without chemicals. I use this for my chains, bracelets and rings without chemicals and it always works great. For the price this is a great mid range sonic cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Epillon

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: A friend raved about how well this cleaned her jewelry, so I got it on impulse. However, I'm not a fan. It did spiff up a couple of pieces, but does nothing for tarnish on silver or the green discoloration on my gold plated jewelry. I still have to clean all of that by hand, so I should have just borrowed my friend's cleaner once a year for the few pieces it worked on. I did recently learn I could use it for dental pieces, so maybe I'll have a really clean bite guard, but I have yet to haul it out of the closet for that one item.
customer_reviews.author: Jen M

customer_reviews.title: Be careful!
customer_reviews.text: This product works exactly as described. But I will caution you, do NOT put polarized glasses in this device because it will ruin your glasses. It's not the manufacturer's fault this happened, it was my own fault. Also, this device is quite powerful. I put a ring from the 1920's in it and it actually caused one of the prongs to break off & one of the diamonds fell out. I didn't realize it until I'd already dumped the water down the drain. So again, this was user error, not company error. It cleans great! The rings I have had very cloudy diamonds and sapphires and this made them super clear again. Overall I'd recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Jewelry Came Out As It Went In
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry I wasted money on this item including the recommended cleaner soap. The silver jewelry looks exactly the same as before dipping it in. I ended up using a toothbrush and toothpaste and it worked much better for a fraction of the price. Only the stones look nice but other than that it is not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: AGLEZ

customer_reviews.title: Works Great; Brittle Construction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to clean my resin 3D prints, which it does very well. After using it for about 5 weeks (on weekends when I have time to run and monitor my printers; a total of around 30 cleaning cycles), the molded lid broke around one of the hinge pins. I can still use it - it still cleans well - but it's a bit of a pain to have to monkey around with the lid to get it open and closed without having the lid fall off (and subsequently having to re-seat it) every time I run it. I'll replace it sooner or later, but I'm on the fence as to whether I'll buy this model again.
customer_reviews.author: K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I previously had an ultrasonic cleaner for about 8 years. It finally konked out on me a couple weeks ago. So I searched for another one and I'm not disappointed with the Magnasonic Cleaner. It does a great job! I honestly don't use the jewelry cleaner liquids. I learned from a few professional jewelers that equal parts hot water and ammonia work great. You're supposed to operate the cleaner with the lid closed - if you forget, don't worry the ammonia will remind you!
customer_reviews.author: ProudMiMi

customer_reviews.title: So weak it's almost useless.  Almost.
customer_reviews.text: My wife's primary interest in this device was cleaning jewelry. Mine was cleaning small parts, and first, the filter of a tea brewer. In the lab, before I retired, I would put whatever in a glass beaker filled with solutions and zap it, keeping the ultrasonic bath clean, This puppy could drive through a glass. When the filter was put directly in the bath. The max time is not long enough, but after several runs I started to see some material come off. When I put the filter directly above the cavitron it sped up, but it clearly will take quite some time. Update: This thing is completely useless. It doesn't clean anything. Spend more, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Patou

customer_reviews.title: Works Okay, but not better than jeweler
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on the great reviews. My husband is a former jewelry salesman and I had him inspect the ring to prevent any stones from falling out. It was very easy to assemble, please basket into machine and add water. I placed the rings into the basket for 480 seconds (longs cleaning setting). The noise level was very low and the machine ran for the entire 480 seconds. When I pulled the ring out it was visibly cleaner, but no how the jeweler cleans the ring. I ended up uses a toothbrush to polish further and it was sparkling like new. This product is okay, but it does replace the elbow grease you have to put in.
customer_reviews.author: Eddine Luma

customer_reviews.title: Not good for glasses with any type of coating
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to clean my glasses. I have several pair which all have some type of coating on them (scratch-resistant, anti-reflective, ect.). As reported by other reviews, which I should have paid more attention to, glasses coatings don't stand up well to this type of cleaning. I began to see small spots on my glasses after using. They were a bit smaller than a pin head but if I continued cleaning them this way there became more of them. I have gone back to soaking my glasses in warm water with a tiny bit of dishsoap and then rinsing in fresh water. It's not as convenient but it doesn't hurt the glasses coating.
customer_reviews.author: Lovin' retirement

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this ultrasonic cleaner. It is very simple to use and cleans great. I put my eyeglasses in water with a few drops of dish soap. Once I turned the unit on, you can see the foaming action dissolving dirt and grime from around the nose pads and hinges. In the past, I would have spent 30 minutes with a Q-Tip cleaning my glasses. I also use this cleaner for removing resin from my models that I print with my 3D DLP resin printer. I used Isopropyl alcohol rather than water. The ultrasonic action works great as well! The unit is compact and light and stores easy. Great price also!
customer_reviews.author: Garret Bertrand

customer_reviews.title: I never knew how dirty I was...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible. We originally purchased it as a jewelry cleaner but soon learned that there was an even better use: cleaning glasses. I always knew that using a cloth to wipe the lenses of my glasses wasn't really cleaning them but this thing shows me (time and time again), just how filthy of a human I must be. It's so incredible to put my glasses in and watch all the dirt and grease set free. We still use it for jewelry as well (and it does a great job with that too)--but for my money, glasses are the star of the show.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Stern

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to clean my razor head. Used hot tap water and a few drops of Dawn dish washing soap, as others had. Didn't fully clean my razor head. I use a pre-shave, and over time it accumulates a sludge in the head. The soap and water combination don't remove it. Using the basket seems to dull the vibrations of the unit. I finally got my razor clean by using alcohol and laying the head in without the basket and running it for the max time. Otherwise, my wife's jewelry cleaned OK.
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Does not Clean- must be paid reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift. I am a jewelry and familiar with this item. This product does not work and the company will not take it back. Try another product. I believe anyone who states this is working well does not know about jewelry. A tooth brush with tooth paste or baking soda works better than this and is safe for all stones.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Cleans Brighton
customer_reviews.text: I was Leary of buying this because the cost vs just buying a cheap jar of the usual chemical cleaner. I had nothing to lose because there was free reruns. I ran it through one cycle with dawn dish soap and hot water. Then I started to toss my dirtiest jewelry in it.... WOW! Results were amazing! Quick and great results! I am so happy with this product. I have a lot of Brighton jewelry than you cannot use a chemical on or it will be ruined, this machine worked great for all of my Brighton!
customer_reviews.author: jodi

customer_reviews.title: Great product at great price.
customer_reviews.text: This product did what it advertised; cleaned my jewelry. I followed the instructions; which are just to make sure you add water and not pass a certain level. Put my jewelry in, and pressed the button. That's it. I did run it through twice to make sure, but it did work wonders. Virtually no noise at all. Easy clean up aftwerwards. Big enough to put most jewelry in. Always make sure that you read instructions to see what you can and cannot put in the machine.
customer_reviews.author: LoU_Da_MaN

customer_reviews.title: Cleans Jewelry with Dish Soap!
customer_reviews.text: This cleaning machine is awesome! I only used it with water and dish soap, and multiple sessions for deep cleaning, as the instructions say to do. I'm impressed and have been searching for more jewelry to clean!! I recommend this item. It is easy to clean the machine and it isn't too loud.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: BUZZZZZZZZZZZZZ
customer_reviews.text: I like writing with fountain pens, and I probably have about 20 of them. But I have not been using them regularly for quite some time, so I needed to clean them. The ultrasonic cleaner does a great job getting all the dried ink out of the pen. I've put as many as three pens in the cleaner - barrel, nib, and cap - and they have all come clean. Once particularly gummed-up pen took three 180 second cycles, but I'm writing with it again now. If you have small things to clean, this cleaner is a deal. Oh, don't be surprised if you dog seems to be able to hear the sound - mine seemed to.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Hemsley

customer_reviews.title: I only got 7 years of rough use out of it.  LOL. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in 2013 and I've been using it mostly in my shop for small greasy items, tools, etc. It has held up well to abuse, I have treated it with no respect and the only clean part is normally the inside, where it always performed well. It might have lasted longer but I accidentally dropped it in a sink of water while giving it a rare cleaning. I think 7 years was great, especially considering how I AB/used it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Enlow

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Stopped working after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY should have heeded the warnings. It just stopped working about 5 months to the day. That means every time I cleaned my Invisalign it cost me $.26, since I used it daily. Not a good buy. I would never buy this again and promise myself that I will heed the reviews. I didn't even try to get a refund since other people had tried. Piece of junk that will have to end up in a landfill.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Will

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Jewelry Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I know there are already 11,945 reviews at the time of writing this, but I just had to add mine. This is the first time that I have ever reviewed a product - 58 yrs old - and I am absolutely obsessed with this jewelry cleaner. I added the Blitz Gem & Jewelry Cleaner Concentrate to the water. My jewelry looks like it has been professionally cleaned. The unit is small and lightweight. I am keeping it on the counter in my bathroom and just toss my jewelry in before going to bed and turn it on in the morning. I can't recommend this jewelry cleaner enough. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ronwald

customer_reviews.title: Failed at what it promises to do
customer_reviews.text: This is a worthless product that did not clean jewelry, eyeglasses or anything else I tried. I followed the directions carefully, but the process is 100% ineffective. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Lausa

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very effective cleaner. Tips I found and use are: 1) soak in Windex for 10 minutes prior to putting into the cleaner. 2) Use "coffee hot" distilled water 3) Use 1 of the 2 top-rated cleaner formulas on Amazon 4) Rinse in "coffee hot" distilled water 5) Lay out to air dry Rarely and only for really dirty items do I need to go beyond 3 minutes
customer_reviews.author: D Clark

customer_reviews.title: This is the best little machine
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little machine. It's compact, easy to put away, easy to pull out. Just add water and turn it on. I ran it the longest cycle each time. The directions say you can add soap if desired, however soap leaves a film, so I used a tiny drop of shampoo. I first ran my jewelry with water 5-8 times. I dumped out the water after each cycle to see how dirty it was. The last 2 times I added shampoo. My rings are cleaner than any jeweler has clean for me. I can promise you will be very happy with this machine. I stared at my jewelry sparkling in the light for the rest of that day.
customer_reviews.author: Animalsdogsathruz

customer_reviews.title: A must have for an Optician!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cleaner as a ten year work anniversary gift to myself as an Optician. I cannot remember how I did my job without this item! It gently cleans the toughest part of glasses that I wouldn’t normally be able to get to, without taking the glasses apart. The best part of it is when I bring the glasses back to a patient, and they are shocked by how clean they are. I would buy this product all over again!
customer_reviews.author: Carmen M. Burak

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Was hyped about having clean jewelry after reading tons of good reviews. Received it today and followed the easy instructions. Ran the cleaning for the longest time possible multiple times with and without cleaning detergent. Jewelry still managed to come out like I just ran it under the faucet, barely any difference. Pretty useless in my opinion, and I regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Spitz

customer_reviews.title: works great on airbrush parts
customer_reviews.text: i bought this and the Blitz concentrate. i was neglectful with two airbrushes about a year ago and forgot to clean out the left over enamel and acrylic model paints. both Iwata and Harder Steembeck airbrushes were seized up. with the recommended amount of dilution i soaked the items in the tank and kept running it over and over til the solution was no longer clear (about 6 times, so 8 full minute cycles). the hardened paint finally gave way and i was able to wipe them all down. two expensive airbrushes are good as new now.
customer_reviews.author: DarrenA

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why so many 5 star reviews?!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why so many 5 star reviews?! Works as it should however after only a few uses the plastic case/body is starting to crack around a screw hole like the screw was overtightened! Definitely not quality, let's see how long it lasts. UPDATE After using for about a month it has begun to fall apart! The handle on the lid was the first to go now the lid came off all together. It's completely stained on the outside and can't be cleaned. The only redeeming factor is it still works.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Works well but research the jewelry first
customer_reviews.text: I use this between my 6 month ring cleanings at my jewelers. It works very nicely to keep things looking shiny. I also use it to clean my earrings and other random jewelry when it starts to look worn out. I would recommend using a drop of dish soap like it describes in the directions instead of just regular water. I've noticed a difference in the cleanliness when using soap. Also, do some research on the type of stone you're cleaning. I ruined my aquamarine stone with this. Apparently it's a soft stone and now there's hairline fractures all over the stone, but it's my own fault.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Ohhhh sparkly!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Can't take my jewelry to get cleaned at the jewelry store because of covid so I bought this, and man it is so small and cute (good for storage) and a real powerhouse. It scrubbed 8 months of grime off of my wedding set, 10 years off my diamond stud earrings ( I could actually see the tiny diamond chip again), and made my husbands rope gold necklaces he inherited from his grandma look brand new. I even offered people to drop their jewelry no contact at my house and cleaned theirs. They were so surprised how shiny and sparkly everything was.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Like so many others, I bought this to keep my engagement ring looking gorgeous. And I am super glad I did! My fiancée joked that I ran this thing 15x as soon as I got it. And I probably did. I cleaned everything that I could. With the rings I liked the suggestion of adding a little bit of dish soap. If you do, I recommend running it a few times with it, then putting in fresh water without soap and running it a couple more times. My ring looks amazing (again).
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: Quick, simple and safe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my wife after I saw her cleaning her jewelry with toothpaste and a old toothbrush. She immediately cleaned her wedding and engagement rings and was amazed at how sparkling and shiny they came out. She immediately started clearing ALL her jewelry. This ultrasonic cleaner is simple to operate with digital controls. It has a stainless steel basin that holds the jewelry and the cleaning solution so you cn just wipe it out after using. This really saves time and money by cleaning at home instead of seeking out a jeweler. Since nothing abrasive is used, there is no change of harming your jewelry.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Cleans like a charm- especially when you add 1 tsp. of dishsoap
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing jewelry cleaner! It's been a full year since I had my engagement ring cleaned and my diamond studs properly cleaned and, after I received the Magnasonic this afternoon, they look brand new! I am currently in the process of cleaning every single piece of jewelry I have now... Because I can. Wow. I really wish I would've purchased this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact that it had a removable basket. That is very important. I don't like the fact that 1 month before the ONE YEAR mark it DIED ! Amazon honored the warranty but I was docked $8.32 for a restocking fee for an item that is out of the 30 day mark. Apparently this unit has longevity issues, please be aware; just because its makes noise doesn't mean its working. If it is not vibrating bubbles its not working. Mine started making a very loud noise and there was no more vibrating bubbles which is the whole point of an ultrasonic cleaner.....
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Made old jewelry look brand new
customer_reviews.text: Glad I broke down and decided to try this device. It is really amazing how well it cleans. It must be the sonic vibration that gets the grunge out of all those little crevices in my jewelry. Now I drop my rings and necklaces that I wear daily, in once a week and it keeps them looking brand new. The basket is quite large, much bigger than needed for jewelry so I suppose you can clean other things too. Be careful tho with cheap painted costume jewelry, it did take the paint off a set of earrings I had. Oh well I should have known better!
customer_reviews.author: Sp205

customer_reviews.title: Great Jewelry Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have high expectations for this machine when I first purchased it. But, thought if my jewelry looked even a bit cleaner, that would be an improvement. You can hear something going on when you turn it on, but it's so mild - surely, it can't be doing much. Well, this little guy is awesome!! My jewelry sparkles the same as when my jeweler cleans it! Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Ania

customer_reviews.title: Great cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: I use this with Barbicide cleaning solution for my nail products and it works wonders. The vibration will not work unless you have the tray filled with the exact amount of liquid needed so be sure to follow measurements correctly. The vibration isn't super noticeable anyways but you can see the surface of the liquid going. I've never had any problems with it so far and it's an added layer of cleaning for my products (the Barbicide does all the disinfecting but the ultrasonic cleaner really vibrates all of particles and debris off of my tools.
customer_reviews.author: Miss CCTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Great little cleaner for the price
customer_reviews.text: This isn't as powerful as sonic cleaners I have used in the past, but those were $1,000 cleaners. For the price, this thing does a really good job. I put a pair of my old glasses in there (removed the lenses) and as soon as I hit the start button, you start to see all the grime start floating away from the frame. I have used this on some computer components as well, and it does a pretty good job at getting crude off.
customer_reviews.author: juniorkirk

customer_reviews.title: It's gross
customer_reviews.text: The leftover solution after cleaning my daily watch on the 180 second setting was gross! I should've taken a picture to show how effective it is, but it works pretty good! We also cleaned a 3 week old engagement ring for the 1st time (before the watch, using the same solution), unfortunately a tiny diamond from the hidden halo setting came off but was easily seen in at the bottom. Either it's just that good or the tiny posts were just loose. Excited to try it out for sunglasses/eyeglasses and the rest of the watch collection.
customer_reviews.author: 1rene0

customer_reviews.title: Glad I finally bought one
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with the quality of the little machine. I have worn my two necklaces for over two decades. Even though I occasionally took them off to soak the pendants and chains in soap water, they still accumulated some dirt. When I bought this machine to clean my fiancee’s jewelry, I decided to try it out with my necklaces first. Man did it work like a charm. A dash of dish soap with adequate amount of warm water produced an amazing result. Highly recommend this product! Now I’m going to clean everything I can fit into the container!
customer_reviews.author: DYL

customer_reviews.title: Works Exactly as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to clean electric razor heads. I was amazed at the great job it did the first time I tried it. It removed dirt and grime from the smallest crevices in only 90 seconds. I also cleaned some eyeglasses, which it did really well. I chose this product because of the great ratings and I haven't been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Badog

customer_reviews.title: Probably defective?
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this ultrasonic cleaner due to the primarily positive reviews posted. However, in my case it failed to clean either lightly smudged glasses nor any jewelry/coins with obvious (greasy) staining. Tried running multiple cycles with and without dish soap but neither cleaned even remotely. Had more success lightly scrubbing with a soft toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Juli89

customer_reviews.title: Great cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a smaller cleaner that died. I like this one as it is larger and I can clean things like my glasses, etc. in it. My old one seemed to rattle around my jewelry a lot, but this one is quiet and easy on the pieces. The only thing I don't like is that is it difficult to remove the basket from the unit. I have arthritis in my hands and can't "pinch" things like I used it, and this requires pinching the edge and pulling out. I sometime have to get my tweezers to pull it up until I can grab it better.
customer_reviews.author: N. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning eyeglasses
customer_reviews.text: I had thought I cleaned my glasses, prior to using this device, thoroughly. I was wrong. The first time I used the ultrasonic cleaner, I had to dump the water several times due to clouding and debris from the dirt removed. The lenses are now crystal clear, and the nose guards are spotless and shiny. Intra-day cleaning with the microfiber cloth feels different - I believe it's because the lenses are cleaner, and have less oil on them, to begin with. I wish I had bought this thing sooner instead of attempting to clean the lenses with microfiber several times a day.
customer_reviews.author: Alex F Sherman

customer_reviews.title: It does not work
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to save money and have the convenience of cleaning my own jewelry and it back fired. I got this item for Christmas and finally used it and it did not work at all - not even a little. Worst of all I can't return it. I tried cleaning gold and silver.
customer_reviews.author: erics

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve wanted one of these for a long time. I finally decided to get one after my wedding ring started making my finger itch because it was so dirty! I had to run it through on the longest setting several times to get it cleaned because my ring has so many crevices that are hard to get to. Now I just do it every few days and my ring looks gorgeous. I also use it on my glasses once a week to get them really clean. Can be used with water only or with a little dish or hand soap added. I have soft water so I’m not sure about using it with harder water. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Talina McGill

customer_reviews.title: Micro Vibrator came unglued from the bottom in let than a year.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one I bought. The first two were the smaller model. I bought this one on May 29, 2019. It never seemed to produce as much vibration as the cheaper, smaller ones. Then it quit making any sound or vibration. I noticed when I picked it up to clean it there was a rattle in the bottom. It was obvious the glue hadn't held. Probably defective from the beginning. Too bad really, everything else about the unit is quality. I hesitate to order another one for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: DaveInTucson

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this for the good reviews. I have always cleaned my jewelry with ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not 100% sure what to think. I have never had another jewelry cleaner before so I have nothing to compare, I purchased this for the good reviews. I have always cleaned my jewelry with a toothbrush and toothpaste. I wanted something more convenient though that I could do everything at once. It did clean it but I was not impressed. I added a couple drops of soap and put it on the longest time. I like it but not in love and think my toothbrush method gives my rings a better sparkle. I will try again though and maybe a couple different techniques like adding vinegar. If I end up liking it more then I will adjust my review.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Cordova

customer_reviews.title: More a toy than a tool
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to clean my glasses and my wife's wedding/engagement rings. The glasses were not all that clean and the diamonds on her rings were not clean at all. Yes, it made them a little more sparkly, but they were not actually clean. Her engagement ring has a diamond in a raised setting, so you could see dirt on the base of the stone. After 3 cleanings, it was still there. So, it seems that if I want it clean, or any other jewelry, I will have to take it to a jeweler or get a better cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: BULLGATOR

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Little Machine
customer_reviews.text: Impressive little machine. I have a lot of jewelry. I’ve used the liquid jewelry cleaners and they’re ok. I cleaned all of my jewelry in less than 30 minutes. I also cleaned 4 pairs of eye glasses. Even with eyeglass cleaning solutions they still weren’t crystal clear. They came out amazing. Now I can clean all of my glasses at home and don’t have to make a special trip to the eye dr office to get them cleaned. The pictures don’t do justice to how sparkly my jewelry is.
customer_reviews.author: maggymaybelle

customer_reviews.title: Clean Jewelry at Home, Save Money, Make it Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife and she loves it. It is quick and easy to use, has different time settings, and does an excellent job. We just use warm water and a little dish soap for most items. I’ve included pictures of the basic item and instructions. I’ve had other jewelry cleaners and this one is the best.
customer_reviews.author: gsxr

customer_reviews.title: Effective and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use -- just plug it in, add water, and press some buttons. I like having the multiple timer settings so I can run it for different lengths of time. It's very effective with just plain water, as I used it on some jewelry and my glasses, and it got all of the greasy gunk off my glasses.
customer_reviews.author: T. Anschutz

customer_reviews.title: Sparkle
customer_reviews.text: Wedding day clean. I will say, these pictures do not do it justice. I uploaded a video on the whole cleaning process and you can see a difference, but you can see the BIGGEST difference in person. I purchased this item along with the blitz concentrate to clean them the morning of my wedding and I am so happy with the result. The rings in the video are bran new, not worn (except for my engagement but that was cleaned by the jeweler recently and not worn since), but the amount of sparkle my ring had after taking it out of the machine is GORGEOUS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tara D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to clean my jewlery and get that shine I get when I go to the jeweler. With the cleaning solution it works like a charm! Shines everything up. If you are looking for something for tarnished jewlery this will not help. This works on gems and regular sterling silver, platinum, or gold
customer_reviews.author: Nurse beauty715

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results!
customer_reviews.text: I could NOT believe how great this worked! I cleaned all my jewelry. I was stunned at how well it worked. For tarnished sterling silver jewelry, there’s a solution you can order to completely make the items look like new. Otherwise, a squirt of Dawn dish soap and water is all it needs! Does take off some of the finish off of cheap costume jewelry. Overall, I just LOVE this machine.
customer_reviews.author: dmo

customer_reviews.title: Cleans all my jewelry to a sparkling shine
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know how dirty all my jewelry was until I put them through this cleaner. I've since cleaned everything from earings, necklaces, watches, eye glasses, bracelets. I keep it plugged in and clean everything I put on right before I go out. I also recommend using dish soap to enhance it's cleaning power and always clean on the most time. You won't be disappointed and you'll be pleasently if not surprised at how dirty your stuff was and what it looks like after.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Hatz

customer_reviews.title: Convenient. Lower your expectations a little, though...
customer_reviews.text: This works well for jewelry that is not very dirty. A couple of drops of Dawn soap helped. For my jewelry that needed a little more work, I pre-cleaned with my usual solution and then dropped it in. Then the jewelry came out great! So, if you are buying this to maintain jewelry in between a few wears, then this is the one for you. But, if you are expecting to drop in very dirty pieces and expecting to pull your jewelry out looking brand new, this is not going to do it unless you put in a little work. For $40, it is convenient, but not a professional unit.
customer_reviews.author: Damian O. Brown

customer_reviews.title: What works with the Magnasonic ultrasonic jewelry machine.
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully on real gold, silver, and gemstones. Some gold- and silver-plated items cleaned well. The appearance after a cleaning is like new. Do NOT count on it to work with brass or other less refined metals. I was hoping—though not expecting—to see it clean some base metals but no luck, not even with repeated cycles. Best unexpected luck was with a 1917 Great War silver ring of my grandfather's. It cleaned it up quite well, and looks wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: ShopThis

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: This did not clean my jewelry they way some reviewers stated. I ran my pieces through three and four cycles, I tried just water as well as soap and water. Some of my costume jewelry had the finish taken off by this machine, it loosened several stones that I ended up finding under the basket and two of my chains got caught in the holes of the basket and broke. I went out and bought silver jewelry cleaner and gold jewelry cleaner and now my jewelry looks amazing, no thanks to the ultrasonic cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie B.

customer_reviews.title: Just read the directions and go by that and your jewelry look brand new
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely awesome it's not too big not too little it cleans your jewelry for as long as you want depending on how dirty it is leaves at shining so beautifully I would definitely buy it if you want to have a good jewelry cleaner but I also bought the jewelry cleaner solution I put my jewelry in there and the hottest water possible for about 10 minutes then I pour in the four capitals of cleaner do that for 10 minutes and your jewelry will look brand new
customer_reviews.author: Kellie L. Bagby

customer_reviews.title: Very poor durability.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit since March of 2018, 7 months. I have probably used it 2 dozen times to clean my glasses and earring and it has stopped functioning. When I turn it on, it will make a noise, but the water will no longer vibrate, and sometimes it will make no sound at all. When it was functioning, it functioned very well, but 7 months is far too short a life span. I'm quite disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Fab

customer_reviews.title: Not for larger or smaller pieces.
customer_reviews.text: It might be an overall good product, but: * the insert has open cells, that are way too large and smaller pieces of jewelry fall through. * it advertised as a great unit to clean silverware, but it's only long enough to fit a teaspoon. For those reasons I had to return it and transaction was processed flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: Inga Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: It was good while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back in 2017, for occasional cleaning of various small personal items. During the past couple of years, I've used it several times, and it had done a reasonable job of cleaning any items I put into it. However, during the past week or two since I last used the device, it seems to have developed a terminal fault. It will no longer power on; the display remains dark, and none of the buttons are responsive. I would have expected the device to last much longer given the relatively infrequent and light use I put it to. As such, next time I purchase an ultrasonic cleaner I will be selecting a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jack O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Not very good for my glasses
customer_reviews.text: Hmm, not sure this is any use for glasses. Advertised for cleaning glasses. I tried 3-4 pairs, with and without detergent on the high settings. Dust is removed but oils and dirt appear still intact even on the surface. I understand it cant get dirt out of the cracks between the lens and the frame, but it barely got the dust off. The greasy fingerprints and oil on the frame was untouched. Maybe I got a bad one or I have really grungy glasses. For me it was a waste of money, soaking in warm soapy water for 10 minutes worked as well in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Rodesch

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE the Magnasonic Professional Ultrasonic Jewelry Cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the Magnasonic Professional Ultrasonic Jewelry cleaner! I never knew how dirty my jewelry was! It is SO fast and easy to clean everything! I have also used the ultrasonic cleaner to clean my glasses! They sparkle and shine with no smear marks! If you are looking at different ultrasonic cleaners, look no further! The Magnasonic Professional Ultrasonic Jewelry cleaner excellant! It is small and takes up a tiny space. I am using it everyday and sometimes, a few times a day! I know you will love it!
customer_reviews.author: SForsberg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Glasses
customer_reviews.text: I have worn glasses my whole life. I always like when I got to the eye doctor and they deep clean my glasses. They are so crystal clear and perfect. I never could get that at home...until now! This thing is amazing. If you like to cook or grill this is for you. I say that because grease will get on your glasses and it is a pain to get it out. Use this and a few drips of blue dawn. Your glasses will achieve that amazing optometrist clean.
customer_reviews.author: Russell A Horton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and maintain
customer_reviews.text: It does the job and is much easier than using a soak and scrub jewelry cleaner. Easy to clean and maintain. I bought this for my diamond jewelry (hoop earrings, cross, wedding band) and so far everything looks bright and shiny. I used the Dawn liquid soap first time. Its been a long time since I've cleaned my diamond jewelry (which I wear everyday) so maybe after a second cleaning I will be more impressed! I would love to clean my prescription sunglasses in them but I am too nervous since they cost me an arm and a leg. Maybe after using it more and figuring out all its features I will love it, but right now I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jd321

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: wow cleans with just water and a drop of dish soap. I don't need to buy jewelry cleaners ever again. I have to leave the room when I set it deep clean because it is noisy and I'm sensitive to it but no biggie God bless y'all John 14:6 Jesus is the only Way
customer_reviews.author: Akinom

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is a worthless product to purchase. It still working on cleaning a necklace. I have been trying to get it clean for over five hours and it's still not clean. If you all want a better product, pay for the ones the jewelers use or better yet to to the jewelry store to get it done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked great until my mom broke it
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this for my mother on Christmas. We tested it out on my sister's house and they both were amazed. I actually wasn't because I couldn't tell the difference much. I'll just believe that it worked well since they used it multiple times while we were in the US. A few months later, my mom forgot that it's 110 and it blew up. I don't blame the product for it since I even left a tag on the plug saying it's 110V but my mom ignored it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This object does not do what it says it is supposed to do. Not even close.. Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely useless. You’d get the same result by dipping your jewelry in a glass of water. It is so bad I don’t see how they can even marked it as a jewelry cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Okay, at best
customer_reviews.text: This cleaner is okay for cleaning eye wear and normal cleanup of jewelry. I use it about once a week for my daily pieces to remove lotion and soap build up. It does NOT work for pieces that are tarnished, it may remove some but not all. I have a pendant that is heavily tarnished I “cleaned” with this at least 20 times since purchasing it and it still looks the exact same. It just doesn't cut it. However, for a spit shine type cleaning this makes fast, easy work of it and easier on the hands/nails than using an old toothbrush. I wouldn't purchase it again though and only kept because I forgot to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING, BedaZling, Sparkling Diamonds!!
customer_reviews.text: I AM IN LOVE!! This mini cleaner is ABSOLUTELY amazing. I am SO Happy!! My wedding ring is SPARKLING. Also, my diamond necklace has never looked so amazing either. Only other way to get my jewels this clean is to take them to the jeweler; let's be honest...who has time for that?! It is so easy to use too. I just squirted a tiny bit of Dawn dish soap in the machine and turned it on. You can set it for up to 480 seconds. Machine is small too so it's not clunky or hard to store. I am recommending this machine to all my girlfriend's. I cannot stop talking about it. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I did before I had this. Walked around with dingy jewelry and smudged glasses, I guess. I was skeptical, but bought it thinking it would at least be better than nothing. Uh, YEAH. My wedding set looks like it's been professionally cleaned and it's the only thing that gets all the...stuff...off my glasses that cleaning cloths just seem to spread around. I've told all my girlfriends about this thing and recommended they buy one. Press a button and get awesomely cleaned jewelry 3 minutes later? Yes please!
customer_reviews.author: HB in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Metal watch bands and jewelry cleaned spotless!!!
customer_reviews.text: I buy old watches and refurbish them. This little machine is crucial in removing grease and grime built up in the metal watch bands! I put a couple of drops of Dawn Ultra to distilled water and after three full 480 cycles the bands are spotless! All grease, grime and dried sweat are erased completely!!! My wife asked me to clean her rings which were rather dull and somewhat gunked up. Two full cycles later the water was nearly black but the rings and stones were sparkling like new!
customer_reviews.author: Platcrates

customer_reviews.title: Superb cleaning machine
customer_reviews.text: This cleaner is amazing. Diamonds sparkle like brand new. But beware, expect to find a dislodged diamond from time to time. ALWAYS check before you pour out the used solution.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Christy

customer_reviews.title: Wowwww! Should have purchased sooner!!
customer_reviews.text: I wish i had taken a before and after. I only have an after. But i accidentally spilled this creamy Asian sauce in my ring two days ago. And i couldn’t get it clean. I ordered this and it arrived next day shipping. It cleaned my ring up within 390sec!! My screw back earrings sparkle like they did they say i bought them!! This thing is great!! Next cleaning, I’ll take a before to go with the after so you can see the difference
customer_reviews.author: Cherries27

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I found this product to be very easy to use and works well. I'm cleaning several boxes of jewelry for a garage sale and find the ability to use tap water and dish soap to clean the costume jewelry to be so easy. Very glad I purchased this and will be using it for years to come. Nice looking device. You do want to keep it near the sink to empty out the water and drain the jewelry basket.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Emrikson

customer_reviews.title: I signed on to return this and I am ONE DAY LATE!!
customer_reviews.text: It seems like it works, but how do you really know!? I am sorry but I definitely can not tell a difference. The other problem I have is, it is so difficult to dump the dirty water out and clean the inside. I keep it on my bathroom sink and I run the electrical cord around the back of other things to hide it but when I pick it up to dump out the water the cord pulls the things that are hiding the cord. Major PITA! The worst part is that I signed on to return this product and I am 1 DAY LATE!! Really???
customer_reviews.author: Nancy🦚

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: This has quickly jumped up on my list of best purchases ever! My wedding rings were disgusting! Both the band & engagement ring have small diamonds in the bands; they had lost their shine & no light was visible between each, making it so dull. I did have to run this machine several times at the longest setting, cleaning the rings with a baby toothbrush between each cleaning, but now, wow. They look brand new! As does my other gold ring, my diamond earrings, and my silver necklace. And it's so easy to use that I'll clean them more frequently now - they'll never get that bad again.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon J. Wanamaker

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work on silver jewelry.
customer_reviews.text: This does not clean tarnished silver jewelry. I tried hot water with dawn from 8-24 minutes with no luck.🙁
customer_reviews.author: Bitsy_Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!! My jewelry looks brand new. All I used was a few drops of dish soap, and my diamonds were sparkling! You can't visually see the machine doing anything, but it works. I tried an old pair of earrings, and it did pop out one of the diamonds :( I guess i'd rather it fall out here as apposed to when I was wearing it. At least I can have it repaired, so BEWARE if you have loose stones! I even put my fitbit band in there, and it came out like new.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: This actually works
customer_reviews.text: If you are like me your everyday jewelry gets grimy and gross. I used this thing to clean my David Yurman cable bracelets and engagement ring and am amazed at the results! We added a PINCH of dish soap and I think it made a huge difference. My ring looks like when I got it. I think we will use this thing at least once a month for the foreseeable future.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!
customer_reviews.text: The wife was so happy to see that I'd ordered this for her. She had some jewelry that was pretty dirty and needed cleaned. It took a couple tries for this one particular bracelet but it did look a lot better than if we'd just used soap and water! It isn't the quietest of machines but when it's generating the vibrations needed to clean the items, nothing is going to be quiet. Key is it got the jewelry clean like we were told it would.
customer_reviews.author: Chumley

customer_reviews.title: I am in love!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how nice and clean my jewelry is. All I did was use warm water and a 5 drops of dawn dish soap. I was going to buy jewelry cleaner but saw some reviews that they used dawn so I thought hell why not. If it don't work good I will just buy some cleaner. It worked fantastic. Now I take off my jewelry and wedding ring every couple days and put it in the machine. I will be blinging!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable - we'll see how the seller honors the warranty
customer_reviews.text: Used sparingly, maybe an average of 20 times since I got it. Just failed exactly one year into the purchase. Stopped working half way into a cleaning. Timer was still counting down but the buzzing had stopped. So one star for durability, we'll see if the warranty is honored.
customer_reviews.author: T. NamaTop Contributor: Photography

product_meta.title: Magnasonic Professional Ultrasonic Jewelry Cleaner with Digital Timer for Eyeglasses, Rings, Coins (MGUC500)
feature_bullets: Cleans dirty jewelry, eyeglasses, watches, utensils and more in minutes using only tap water
Generates 42,000 Hz of ultrasonic sound waves for a powerful yet gentle clean that won't harm your valuables
Digital display with 5 preset cleaning cycles (90, 180, 280, 380, & 480 seconds) and auto shut off
Extremely easy to operate, includes basket to keep items secure

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
